questions.uddipok:
Read the following passage and fill in each gap with a suitable word based on the information of the passage:
Scientists have identified Hydrogen as another form of renewable energy source. It is the most abundant element in nature. But it does not exist separately as a gas. It is always combined with other elements, such as with Oxygen to make water. Hydrogen, separated from another element, can be burned as a fuel to produce electricity.
Scientists have (a) ____ out that Hydrogen can be (b) ____ as renewable energy source. The nature is (c) ____ with Hydrogen (d) ____ it does not exist separately as gas. Hydrogen and Oxygen (e) ____ water.

Begum Rokeya was born in. 1880 at Pairabondh, a village in the district of Rangpur. Her family was very conservative. Yet she received her education in English and Bengali from her elder brother, Ibrahim Sabir. In 1896, at the age of sixteen, Rokeya was married to Shakhawat Hossain. Shakhawat was pleased to see the eagerness of his wife for education. In 1909, her husband Shakhawat Hossain died. In the same year, she opened Shakhawat Memorial Girls' School at Bhagalpur with only five students. But she was forced to close the school in 1910. She reopened the school in 1911 in Kolkata with only 8 female students. In 1917, Lady Chelmsford, wife of the then Viceroy of India, visited the school. The school still stands at the heart of the city of Kolkata. In 1916, Begum Rokeya established the Muslim Women's Association. Begum Rokeya was a writer also. Through her pen, she tried to awaken the Muslim women of the Indian subcontinent. In 1932, on the 9th December, Begum Rokeya died at the age of 52. At her death, the country plunged into deep grief.
Write a summary of the above passage in your own words.

sub_questions.explanation:
Summary:
Begum Rokeya, a pioneer in women’s education and empowerment, was born in 1880 in Pairabondh, Rangpur, into a conservative family. Despite the constraints, she was educated in English and Bengali by her elder brother, Ibrahim Sabir. At sixteen, she married Shakhawat Hossain, who supported her passion for education. After Shakhawat’s death in 1909, she opened the Shakhawat Memorial Girls' School in Bhagalpur, but it closed in 1910. She reopened it in Kolkata in 1911 with only eight students, and it grew to prominence, even receiving a visit from Lady Chelmsford in 1917. In 1916, she founded the Muslim Women's Association to promote women’s rights. Rokeya also wrote extensively to inspire and awaken Muslim women in the Indian subcontinent. She passed away on December 9, 1932, at the age of 52, leaving behind a legacy of progress and equality that deeply impacted the nation.

Once, there was a king who was fond of knowing his future from the astrologer. A good astrologer visited the capital of the king. The king wished to know his future from the astrologer and so, he
called him to the palace. As the astrologer told something unpleasant, the king got furious and condemned him to death. The astrologer was taken to the place of execution. questions.uddipok:
Answer the following questions to write a paragraph on 'A Book Fair':
(a) What is a book fair? (b) When and where is it held? (c) How popular is it? (d) Have you ever visitied a book fair? (e) What kind of books are usually available in a book fair?

sub_questions.explanation:
A Book Fair
A book fair is a kind of fair where different types of books are displayed for sale. Book fair is now held in every city and town too. It has recently become very popular in our country. People go to the fair to find their desired books. In Bangladesh, a book fair is arranged on the occasion of 21 s t 21^{st} 2 1 s t February, 16 th 16^{\text {th }} 1 6 th December, 26 th 26^{\text {th }} 2 6 th March and Bangla New Year. The fair is held in an open place or in auditorium or in a big hall-room. In our country, the largest book fair is held on the premises of Bangla Academy on the occasion of 21 t h 21^{th} 2 1 t h February. All kinds of books such as fiction, drama, poetry, novel, biography, translation, children literature, story books, etc. are usually available in a book fair. A book fair usually remains crowded. People from all walks of life visit the fair. People who are book lovers come to the fair to buy books and to enjoy the fair. Young boys and girls gather here to find out books of their favourite authors. They buy books to present them as gifts to their near and dear ones and for themselves. From the interest and participation of people, the popularity of book fair in our country can be realised. A book fair bears great importance. Moreover, it creates a sense of interest for books among the general people. It is really an exceptional place. It develops and flourishes our reading habits and thus makes us enlightened. It also helps develop our creativity.

questions.uddipok:
Read the beginning of the story. Use your imagination to complete the story. Give a title of it.
One sunny morning, a boy of eleven years was tending cattle by the side of a railway line. Suddenly, he noticed that a small railway slipper was about to collapse...........

sub_questions.explanation:
The Boy Who Saved the Train

One sunny morning a boy of eleven years old was tending cattle by the side of a railway line. Suddenly he noticed a small railway slipper which was about to collapse. A little while later, he remembered that a mail train was supposed to cross in about half an hour. He thought that something should be done. Otherwise a serious accident might occur. He was thinking what to do: He was looking here and there but found none. Suddenly he remembered that if he showed red signal, the train might stop. As he was wearing a red shirt, at once he took oft his shirt and hung it with a stick. Then he began to wave it in the air. The driver saw it from far away and stopped the train slowly. He came to the boy and asked what happened. The boy took him to the railway slipper. Seeing it the driver thanked him and said that he had saved them. The next day the news was published in different newspapers. The government and many institutions awarded him for his ready wit.

The pie chart shows how a family spends its income in different areas like education, clothes, food, and savings.
Education takes the largest share of the budget, accounting for 40 % 40 \% 40% . This indicates that the family places a high value on education. Clothing is the next largest part of expense, comprising 25 % 25 \% 25% of the budget.
Food expenses account for 20 % 20 \% 20% of the budget, reflecting the family's effort to maintain good health. through proper diet. Finally, 15% of the budget is allocated to savings. Though it's the smallest slice of the pie, this still shows a good effort to set aside money for future needs, emergencies, or investments.
Overall, the pie chart reveals the family's balanced approach to managing their income, with substantial investments in education and a strong emphasis on essential needs like clothing and food. The allocation towards savings shows their future financial stability.

questions.uddipok: Suppose, you are Sajib and your friend is Tania who is living in Sylhet. Now, write an email to your friend describing about the co-curricular activities of your school.

sub_questions.explanation:
Zindabazar, Sylhet
22 April 2020

Dear Nazim,
My heartiest compliments go to you. Hope, that you are hale and hearty. In your last letter you wanted to know about the co-curricular activities in my school.
You know that I am lucky to study in such a big and famous school which offers us facilities to learn a lot of things besides studies. We can depend on our teachers not only for study matters but also for matters related to our interests. Some of them run different clubs in school. The clubs are places where one can go and pursue his or her hobby. I'm a member of the debating club. We practise debating within the club and arrange debating competitions among different classes and among other schools as well. Our English teacher who runs this club, not only guides us in writing good speeches but also shows us how to present them. 'Our school arranges essay competitions and book reading competitions. Moreover, my school offers a wide range of extra-curricular activities for the students. The school has a musical group and a lot of dramas are played by the students. Besides, the students enjoy hockey and football as extra-curricular activities. Teachers consult with the students at personal level and encourage them to work more and more. The students of this school learn not only for examinations but also for life. In short, I can tell you studying in this school is a great experience. Along with the regular study, we can develop our extracurricular abilities as well.
I guess, you are planning to shift to a new school. If you ask for suggestion from me, I'll recommend my school without any hesitation.

With best wishes
Monir

questions.uddipok:
Suppose you are Nabil/Nabila. You have a friend called Nabeen/Nabeena. Both of you are very interested in different types of games and sports.
Now, write a dialogue between you and your friend emphasizing the importance of games and sports in our life.

sub_questions.explanation:
Nabeen/Nabeena ：Hi Nabil/Nabila, where are you heading to?
Nabil/Nabila : Hi, I'm on my way to the sports club.
Nabeen/Nabeena : What do you do there?
Nabil/Nabila : Well, I practise badminton there.
Nabeen/Nabeena : That's interesting!Do you go there often?
Nabil/Nabila : Yes, almost every day. It keeps my body and mind fit. Do you participate in any sports, Nabeen/Nabeena?
Nabeen/Nabeena : Yes, I do.
Nabil/Nabila : Which sports are you interested in?
Nabeen/Nabeena : I usually play cricket and football to keep my body fit and healthy.
Nabil/Nabila : I think, games are essential for good health.
Nabeen/Nabeena : You're right, Nabil/Nabila. Games are essential for a healthy body.
Nabil/Nabila : Some people don't like physical activities. They don't realize the importance of games.
Nabeen/Nabeena : But such people always suffer from one or the other ailment.
Nabil/Nabila : You're absolutely right.
Nabeen/Nabeena : I personally think that games should be made compulsory for the students.
Nabil/Nabila : I agree with you. Games will keep the students healthy and teach them discipline.
Nabeen/Nabeena : Discipline is very essential for the progress of an individual as well as the nation as a whole.
Nabil/Nabila : Games also teach us the spirit of sportsmanship while developing the quality of leadership among the students.
Nabeen/Nabeena : 'Health is wealth', is an old saying. Therefore, to maintain our health we must play games.
Nabil/Nabila : Yes. You're right. Well, I've to go now. We should meet up again, may be next week.
Nabeen/Nabeena : Sure! See you then.
Nabil/Nabila : Bye, bye.
Nabeen/Nabeena : good bye.

questions.uddipok:
Zahir Raihan was one of the most talented filmmakers in Bangladesh. He was born on 19 August 1935 in the village Majupur in Feni district. He was an active worker of the Language Movement. He was one of the ten students to go out in a procession on 21 . February 1952 despite a ban on such activities imposed by the authorities. As a result, he and many others were arrested and taken to prison. Zahir was also present at the historical meeting of Amtala on 21 February 1952. He also took part in the mass movement in 1969. In 1971, he joined the Liberation War.
All through his life, Zahir Raihan dreamt of a democratic society, a society that will ensure freedom of speech and will. He had many dreams about our film industry too. He made a legendary film 'Jibon Theke Neya' based on the Language Movement of 1952. It was a revolt against the autocratic government. The family presented in that film was a miniature East Pakistan ruled by an autocrat who had to go to prison for her conspiracy. During the Liberation War, this film was shown outside Bangladesh. Celebrated filmmakers like Satyajit Ray, Mrinal Sen, and Ritwik Ghatak appreciated the film. Zahir gave all the money to the Freedom Fighters' trust that he get from his film shows. Besides, his great documentary on Pakistani atrocities, 'Stop Genocide', helped create world sentiment in favour of our liberation war.
On 30 December 1971, someone informed Zahir about an address somewhere at Mirpur, where he might find his brother, the famous writer Shahidullah Kaiser. Shahidullah was captured and killed by the Pakistani army and the local collaborators during the last days of the war. Accordingly, Zahir left home to get his brother back but he never returned. Zahir's dream was fulfilled. He could see the inception of a free independent Bangladesh though he did not get back his brother. And it's a pity that this dreamer was missing at such a time when his dream came true.
